pros: Close to housing, student employment, nice work environment
cons: No running water, messy scheduling

job_title: Senior Program Director in Bronxville, NY
pros: Many extraordinary, gifted colleagues who are inspirational to the students and dedicated to the unique mission of the College.
cons: Restrained resources over long periods of time have built problematic levels of resentment in significant segments of the staff and faculty. For an institution that self-identifies as progressive, there are a large number of individuals who are surprisingly resistant to change on any front. These voices often take up a lot of space in conversations and impede decisive action. While there is theoretically space for bold thinking given the mission and history of the institution, the resource challenges often make it difficult to implement new ideas in a way that could significantly shift the needle.

pros: Work environment and coworkers are nice
cons: The technology or lack thereof can be difficult

review_title: Generally, a nice place to work
pros: Work/life balance is encouraged, at least in my office.
cons: The culture doesn't seem unified between the staff, faculty and upper management

pros: All aspects comes in pros
cons: Not encountered any cons so far

pros: Smart dedicated faculty and staff.

pros: Sarah Lawrence continues to build on its history of student-centered education and its mission of graduating world citizens.
cons: The social/political environment and the college’s commitment to sensitively addressing conflicts and perceived crises means forward momentum and growth as an institution can be sidetracked at times.

cons: It is boring, the manager does not care about its employees

review_title: The Art and Price of Teaching.
pros: A very committed faculty is given tremendous freedom in developing courses and assessing outcomes, within a  novel pedagogy, stressing  individual student centered education through mentoring and independent research projects chosen by student and teacher . A very dynamic intellectual community with respect across disciplinary lines.  Students are generally motivated, skilled but above all expressive and creative.
cons: The education is very expensive, the support staffs are generally understaffed.  As indicated by outside sources there is a desperate need to improve finances,  develop a vision, upkeep both the pedagogy and physical plant, and generally improve general administrative/management competence.

job_title: Software Development Researcher in Bronxville, NY
pros: The school did provide stipend and cheap dorm housing for summer student researchers. The professor gave you a lot of attention. There were a good amount of students joining, so it was a good environment. You worked with two or more other students who shared same interests with you, and that's always cool.
cons: Wish the professor would have had a more clear proposal/idea of the research project. He changed his expectations A LOT. The housing was cheap, but keep in mind that Hill house does not have AC. New York summer without AC was a nightmare for me, but I can't afford living outside of campus with the stipend school provided, so...

review_title: This was just my part time job at my college
job_title: Audio Visual Assistant in Ithaca, NY
pros: There are many possible supervisors so your experiences will definitely vary. My supervisors for Audio Visual taught me the basics the first day and were available most times I needed assistance.
cons: Same as the above, there are many possible jobs and supervisors. In the case of Audio Visual, I was only taught the basics and would always need to call my supervisors whenever there was a hardware issue.

pros: The students are great and passionate. They go on to do good things in the world. There are many fringe benefits that come with working at a college if one takes advantage of them.
cons: The college has gone through a few bumpy years (fiscally and PR), but seem to be moving in the right direction.

pros: I got to work with a committed and fun group of colleagues, and the environment was very collegial. We had lots of fun.
cons: The work breaks were too short--only ten minutes! Sometimes I also felt as if there was a disconnect between what our boss wanted and what we thought was expected of us

pros: The administrative staff are very supportive of graduate assistants, and offer them a lot of flexibility. Pay is reasonable for a college.
cons: There is not much lateral or upward mobility. It is not the most dynamic environment (even for a small college).

review_title: Somewhere everyone should work for a few years.
pros: Quality of life. Benefit package. Student interaction.
cons: Communication of decisions. Lack of traditional structure within the academic hierarchy.
